item.title: WSJ Reporter Appears in Russian Court for Detention Appeal Hearing
item.description: The court could uphold pretrial detention, order Evan Gershkovich moved to another jail, allow him house arrest or grant him bail.

item.title: Rising Rates Brought Down Reverse-Mortgage Lender
item.description: A government-backed reverse-mortgage program intended to help seniors tap their home equity ran into problems as interest rates rose, pushing one of the largest participating lenders into bankruptcy last fall, recent court documents show.

item.title: Investors Stay Upbeat on Private Equity, Credit
item.description: A BlackRock institutional investor survey shows most intend to put more money into the asset classes this year.

item.title: Heavy Turbulence on Flights Is Likely to Get Worse
item.description: Meteorologists predict more bumpy flights as climate change makes hard-to-detect clear-air turbulence more common.

item.title: Few Banks Are Hedging Interest-Rate Risk
item.description: As first-quarter earnings season gets into swing, investors are looking for signs of vulnerability—and a recent paper focuses on how banks handle rising rates.

item.title: Safe Security Raises $50 Million in Series B Round
item.description: The cybersecurity company has raised $50 million in Series B financing as insurers and regulators drive efforts to assess cyber risk, boosting interest in its wares.

item.title: Pro Take: A Persistent Holdout in the Fed's Inflation Fight Leads to the Bakery Aisle
item.description: Food prices flatlined in March after rising 8.5% over the past year. But with summer “bun season” right around the corner, a time of baseball outings and barbecue, inflation doggedly holds on in baked goods.

item.title: SEC Chair Gensler to Defend Climate, Crypto Plans Before GOP-Led Panel
item.description: House Republicans and industry groups say the SEC chair’s agenda shows regulatory overreach.

item.title: UPS and Teamsters Kick Off Contract Negotiations
item.description: The two sides are to negotiate a new five-year deal as the Teamsters seek an end to the two-tier wage system.

item.title: Muse Tax, Built on OpenAI's GPT, Targets Tax Codes
item.description: The company is one of many across a range of industries that are starting to figure out how to make use of fast-breaking developments in AI.

item.title: Nurse Shortage Pushes Hospitals Into the Gig Economy
item.description: Apps are luring workers to open shifts with higher pay and shorter hours.

item.title: U.S.-China Tensions Over Taiwan Put Pressure on Europe
item.description: The European Union is finding it increasingly difficult to avoid taking a clear position on a potential military conflict.

item.title: Warren Buffett and Japan's Trading Titans Would Be Formidable Allies
item.description: The Berkshire Hathaway head hinted in a recent interview that his interest in Japan’s trade giants goes beyond just holding their stocks.

item.title: IRS Left Fewer Taxpayers on Hold This Year
item.description: The average wait time to speak to a representative dropped 85% this tax season, officials said.

item.title: Putin Makes Rare Trip to Russian-Occupied Areas of Ukraine
item.description: The Russian president traveled to the Kherson and Luhansk regions and was briefed by senior officers, the Kremlin said, without specifying when the trip took place.

item.title: G-7 Countries Claim Unity on China After Macron Comments
item.description: The G-7 sought to show a unified front on China after recent comments by French President Emmanuel Macron that the EU shouldn’t follow Washington’s lead on Taiwan.

item.title: FTSE 100 Rises as Entain, Miners, Banks Gain
item.description: The FTSE 100 Index edged up as gains for gaming group Entain, miners and banks offset losses for property stocks.

item.title: Seven & I Board Opposes ValueAct's Proposal to Remove CEO, Other Directors
item.description: Seven & i Holdings said its board would oppose a proposal made by San Francisco-based activist investor ValueAct Capital LP to replace board members, including Chief Executive Ryuichi Isaka.

item.title: Sterling Boosted By Strong UK Wage Growth
item.description: Sterling received a modest boost from strong U.K. wage data, even as the jobless rate rose slightly, ING said, as the data has increased expectations the BOE will raise interest rates next month.

item.title: Oil Prices Gain After Chinese GDP Data
item.description: Oil prices held gains in Europe after data showed China’s economic rebound was progressing faster than expected, with many investors betting the country’s post-Covid reopening will support a further advance for crude over the coming year.
